summary: Königsberg, now known as Kaliningrad in Russia, was a historically important German city. Founded in 1255 by Teutonic Knights, it was named after King Ottokar II of Bohemia. The city was a major port and served as the capital of various Prussian states. It had a rich cultural heritage, being a center for German, Lithuanian, and Polish influences. Königsberg was home to many notable figures, like Immanuel Kant and E.T.A. Hoffmann. During World War II, it was heavily damaged and later annexed by the Soviet Union, leading to the expulsion of its German population. The city was renamed and is now part of Russia.
title: Königsberg
